text: Arhopala phaenops, is a butterfly in the family Lycaenidae. It was described by Cajetan Felder and Rudolf Felder in 1865. It is found in the Indomalayan realm.Seitz, A., 1912-1927. Die Indo-Australien Tagfalter Grossschmetterlinge Erde 9 ==Subspecies== *A. p. phaenops Philippines *A. p. detrita (Staudinger, 1889) Palawan *A. p. sandakani Druce, 1896 Borneo, Sumatra, Peninsular Malaya *A. p. termerion Fruhstorfer, 1914 Bazilan *A. p. aytonia Fruhstorfer, 1914 Java *A. p. buruensis Holland, 1900 Buru, Obi ==References== ==External links== *Arhopala Boisduval, 1832 at Markku Savela's Lepidoptera and Some Other Life Forms. Retrieved June 3, 2017. Category:Arhopala Category:Butterflies described in 1865
title: Arhopala phaenops
